intro: Nothaphoebe foetida, commonly known as the fetid nothaphoebe, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
